src:
Πολλοί οι μνηστήρες για το νοσοκομείο της Ρόδου αλλά... δεν είχαν υπολογίσει τον στρατηγό!
Kακίες

02 Nov 2019, 20:00

● Πολλοί ήταν οι μνηστήρες για τη θέση του διοικητή στο νοσοκομείο της Ρόδου αλλά... δεν είχαν υπολογίσει τον στρατηγό ε.α. Γρ. Ρουμάνη! Ξαφνικά το έμαθαν οι περισσότεροι και μάλλον... δεν το πήραν καλά! Αν επαληθευτούν οι σχετικές πληροφορίες, εντός των ημερών θα ξέρουμε!
● Όσοι επίσης ενδιαφέρονται για τη θέση του υποδιοικητή κι εδώ υπάρχει “έκπληξη”. Τη θέση την έχει “καπαρώσει” (πάντα σύμφωνα με πληροφορίες) πρώην κοινοτάρχης.
● Εδώ που τα λέμε πάντως να διοριστούν όλοι δεν γινόταν! Το ενδιαφέρον ήταν έντονο οπότε...

Ο κακός
text:
The youngsters in the Plaça Universitat want to reinforce the camp because they fear eviction of the Mossos
There are more than a thousand participants in a mobilization that "is consolidated", according to a statement

02 Nov 2019, 20:18

Young people camped from Wednesday in the University Square to protest against the "repression" warns this Saturday of a "possible imminent eviction, after the latest mediations with Mossos and public institutions," they say in a statement. That is why young people call for camping in order to keep the protest. The participants consider that the mobilization "is consolidated" and, as they stand out in the communique, they are more than 1,000 camping in more than 500 stores. The campuses join the protest called by the CDR Barcelonès this Saturday at the University Square to denounce the "repression exercised in recent weeks by the governments" and request the resignation of Interior Minister Miquel Buch.
The fourth day of the camp was focused on the "internationalist struggle", with talks on the situation of towns such as Saharan, Kurdish and several of Latin America. They also mounted a column that has joined the demonstration of solidarity with Rojava, a territory in the north of Syria controlled by Kurdish militias and that Turkey has attacked in recent weeks. Young people camped, many students, are defined as Generation 14-O, the date on which the condemnatory sentence of the pro-independence leaders was published.
